config_description: Defensive settings for protecting Cassandra from true network partitions. See (CASSANDRA-14358) for details.  The amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' is used to determine the amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish. The code checks if the value is already set, and if not, it retrieves the value from the DatabaseDescriptor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' configuration depends on the frequency of internode tcp connections being established in the system. It will be triggered whenever a new internode tcp connection is being established.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' configuration option is that it helps in protecting Cassandra from true network partitions by setting a timeout for internode tcp connections. This can prevent potential issues that may arise from long waiting times for connections to establish.
